entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:24PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf through Monday Night at Shishmaref... North to northwest winds 10 to 20 mph with increasing Monday morning to north at 20 to 35 mph with elevated surf developing west of Cape Espenberg. Waves will wash up near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:24PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf through Monday night... West to northwest winds 15 to 25 mph will be increasing tonight to 20 to 35 mph with elevated surf developing through the evening and continuing into Monday night before winds diminish. Waves will wash up near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:12PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow in the Brooks Range... Snow levels in the Brooks Range will be falling to around 2000 feet by Monday evening with up to 4 inches of accumulation expected by Tuesday morning. Temperatures will also be falling with the low temperatures in the passes falling to the uppers 20s.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeastern Brooks Range; Northwestern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 11:29AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...CAUTION REGARDING HIGH WATER ON THE MENDENHALL RIVER... entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 7:11PM CDT until August 07 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR WEST CENTRAL TALLAPOOSA AND SOUTHEASTERN COOSA COUNTIES WILL EXPIRE AT 715 PM CDT... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire.
